data.name: Garchomp C LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Garchomp C. Garchomp C LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

abilities.name: Healing Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Garchomp C LV.X from your hand onto your Active Garchomp C, you may remove all damage counters from each of your Pokémon SP.

attacks.name: Dragon Rush
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Garchomp C. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Garchomp C can't use Dragon Rush during your next turn.

data.name: Xerneas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: X Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use X Blast during your next turn.

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

data.name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
rules: Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

abilities.name: Cosmic Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your hand and put them on the bottom of your deck in any order. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Shining Magikarp
data.flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
rules: You can't have more than 1 Shining Magikarp in your deck.

attacks.name: Gold Scale
attacks.text: Your opponent may draw 2 cards. Either way, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Bond
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card named Gyarados, Dark Gyarados, or Shining Gyarados. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Rocket's Admin.
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player counts his or her Prize cards left and draws up to that many cards. (You draw your cards first.)

data.name: Reshiram
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Donphan by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: M Rayquaza-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.

ancientTrait.name: Δ Evolution
ancientTrait.text: You may play this card from your hand to evolve a Pokémon during your first turn or the turn you play that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Emerald Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Rocket's Zapdos.

attacks.name: Electroburn
attacks.text: Rocket's Zapdos does damage to itself equal to 10 times the number of Lightning Energy cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Birthday Surprise
attacks.text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Cleffa
data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 7 cards.

data.name: Umbreon ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

abilities.name: Dark Ray
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Umbreon Star from your hand onto your Bench, you may choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Gardevoir ex δ
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been knocked out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Imprison
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Gardevoir ex is your Active Pokémon, you may put an Imprison marker on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Any Pokémon that has any Imprison markers on it can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies. This power can't be used if Gardevoir ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Gardevoir ex to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Groudon
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Magma in its name is 3 or less, Team Magma's Groudon can't attack.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Pulverize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Luxray GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Luxray GL. Luxray GL LV. X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous Level.

abilities.name: Bright Look
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Luxray GL LV.X from your hand onto your Active Luxray GL, you may switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Tapu Lele-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Wonder Tag
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Drive
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Tapu Cure-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Blastoise
data.flavorText: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

data.name: Venusaur
data.flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.name: Imposter Professor Oak
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

data.name: Dark Gyarados
data.flavorText: Normally found only in the deep ocean, it has recently been seen in shallow waters as well.

abilities.name: Final Beam
abilities.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Mew ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been knocked out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: Mew ex can use the attacks of all Pokémon in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Power Move
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to Mew ex. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, you may switch Mew ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.
